name: Residence Inn Atlanta Gwinnett Place

reviews.text: A little run down compared to other Residence Inns in which I have stayed. Room was a little less clean than expected. 2 room suite only available in 2 queens, no doubles. The worst part, which made the whole experience go south, was the smell of the hallway when we entered. One word: urine. Smelled like the bowels of a Paris subway. *Shudder* Not exactly the welcome I expected upon entering the building. Go elsewhere.
reviews.title: Ok if you don't mind the smell of pee
Good Service, Good Location, Ask for Refurbished Room
reviews.text: With 2 kids under 3 years old, a suite is a necessity. The hotel service and location were excellent. The room could have been cleaner. The carpet needed to be replaced. The hotel is within close proximity to Gwinnett Mall, the grocery store and every restaurant you can imagine. While we were there the hotel began room renovations. There was no noise from the work. Definitely ask for a refurbished room. We received a great rate. I'd definitely stay again in a refurbished room.

reviews.title: Hard to find, but a good deal
reviews.text: It's tucked behind the Marriott and several others, but the Residence Inn in Duluth GA (off I-85 NE of ATL, about 25 mins from 5 points, 45 from the airport). Best deal of a tough locale. I paid $120 for 1 night during the week and it was $25 dollars cheaper than anything in the area. Good but not great buffet bkfst, room are quite clean & a good size, two floor set-up with interior halls. Refridgerators, kitchenettes (with sink d/w and utensils) and seating areas in the rooms. Beds and climate control are both fine. The prob is that there are several bldgs. You register in the "main bldg" then schlepp your stuff to the bldg that your room's in. It's annoying to have to get back in the car to go to your room after you've gotten out of it to check in, but that's the deal. I got dropped off by cab, so I had to wander from the registration office to "my" bldg when I was tired, cranky and NOT in the mood. THat's the only gripe.
The hotel staffs are nice and kind.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: We had 2 rooms, 1 of 1 room suite and 1 of 2 room suite.
reviews.title: In the center of it all.

likes.liked: — Next door to steak joint. Nicer amenities.

reviews.text: It would be nicer if they have a 2 doble bed instead of 1 queen and 1 sofa bed. The sofa bed was really uncomfortable.
reviews.title: You Will Love This Place

reviews.text: This is your typical wonderful Residence Inn. It is clean. The rooms look similar to most of the other Residence Inns so I feel like I am at home.
reviews.title: Southern Hospitality!

reviews.text: The Customer Service is great. There is a free breakfast that is pretty good. It is also next door to a steak joint which is great for picking up dinner fast. I love that I do not have to get into a car to do this.
reviews.title: Very Welcoming

likes.liked: — Large room with kitchenette, free internet, free breakfast, and social evenings

reviews.text: I stayed for a week and felt like I was living in a condo! full kitchen separate bedroom , great location , great price.
reviews.title: Great hotel , like being in an apartment

reviews.text: Honestly, I don't get into writing these reviews but I just had to write one about this one. I see how important it is to read these reviews so I vowed I would write one when I got home. I just want to say that me and my family were very impressed with this hotel. The grounds were great, the rooms were great and the breakfast too! We first pulled up and my family began to compliment the outer appearance. When we arrived in our rooms, they were HUGE and there was a big den area, a nice size kitchen and eating area, and two bedrooms on each side with separate TVs. In total, there were three TVs. There was also a nice size bathroom with a big vanity area and a big closet. The beds were so soft that I almost cried when I had to get up! This looked like an apartment. The next morning, we ate breakfast and we even made our own belgian waffles! I saw other students who were there for the graduation and they were also impressed. This was so nice. The staff was nice too!
reviews.title: I recommend this hotel!

reviews.text: I recently had an overnight stay at this Residence Inn and, due to an electrical problem (the wall switch shot sparks when I turned on the bathroom light), had to be upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite. The rooms were nice, clean, and comfortable. The decor is very tasteful and the rooms don't smell like most other hotels that accept pets.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay....get your breakfast early.

reviews.text: The staff was also very friendly.
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.liked: — Free Wifi, Breakfast and Fab Staff

reviews.text: My only complaint is that the breakfast buffet was not fully stocked when I came down to eat at 8 am. The attendant was in no particular hurry to get the food items out to us and we had to wait 15 minutes for fresh food.
reviews.title: LOVED this pplace!

likes.liked: — Very quiet, could not hear neighbors inside OR outside!

reviews.text: I've stayed at the Residence Inn for two nights. My studio apartment (including a kitchen with micro, cooking stove, fridge, etc) was spacious with a homely touch. Both the kitchen and the laundry facilities will save who ever stays for a longer duration quite a lot of cash.
reviews.title: A great hotel

reviews.text: The hotel shuttle was available and staff was very helpful. They've made one mistake with getting me a taxi back to the hotel so I would recommend that you double check that. Apart of that they were just amazing – for example, letting me do a very late check-out (8 P.M) with charging me!
reviews.title: Wow, wish I had found this hotel sooner. Awesome stay!

reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was very good – fresh with a wide selection.
reviews.title: nice hotel property, conveniently located

reviews.text: As the title says: a great hotel!
reviews.title: Good Hotel for a Great Price

reviews.text: I have been working in Duluth and suburban Atlanta for the last 3 years. I have stayed at many hotels in the area and chose this one recently because my usual hotel did not have the room I wanted. What a pleasant surprise! This is by far the best hotel in the area. My suite had a full kitchen and it was huge! Everything was so clean and everyone at the hotel was so nice. I really liked the free snacks and wine when I came back to the hotel at night. Just what I needed after a long day!
reviews.title: Never stay here again.

aka: Residence Inn Atlanta Gwinnett Place Hotel Duluth
